newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Lung Kee hits new high, seen as buy.
newsitem.headline: Lung Kee hits new high, seen as buy.

text.p: Lung Kee Metal Holdings Ltd hit a new year high at US$1.18 in early Thursday trade after it reported better-than-expected earnings for the year ended March 31, 1997.
At 0130 GMT, shares of the mould base maker were flat around US$1.15 on over 402,000 shares traded.
The company reported on Wednesday its net profit was at Hong Kong $98.46 million. Turnover hit HK$396.08 million.
These were above its own forecast of HK$93.5 million net profit and a turnover of HK$381 million made in the prospectus during the launch of its intitial public offer in January.
Analysts said the results were five percent above the market consensus and they were maintaining buy recommendations on the company.
"I am reiterating a buy recommendation and am expecting a 15 percent growth in its net profit this year," GK Goh analyst David Chan told Reuters.
Chan said Lung Kee's current share price remained attractive given the company's prospects.
"Current price is trading at 15.5 times 1998 price earning (PE)," he said.
This was more attractive compared to competitor Japan-based mould base maker Futaba Corp, trading at over 32 times PE.
